name: ValidateSuppressionRule
description:
Validate a suppression rule in Datadog's monitoring system.

This tool validates suppression rules in Datadog's security monitoring configuration. Use it to ensure rules are correctly set up and functioning as intended.

parameters.name: suppression_rule_name
parameters.description: The name of the suppression rule to be validated.

value_schema.description: The name of the suppression rule.

parameters.name: suppression_rule_query
parameters.description: The rule query for the suppression rule, using detection rules search bar syntax.

value_schema.description: The rule query of the suppression rule, with the same syntax as the search bar for detection rules.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Defines the type of the resource. Always set to `suppressions`.

value_schema.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be `suppressions`.

parameters.name: is_suppression_rule_enabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the suppression rule is currently active.

value_schema.description: Whether the suppression rule is enabled.

parameters.name: exclusion_query_on_input_data
parameters.description: An exclusion query for input data, such as logs or events. Events matching this are ignored by detection rules in the suppression rule.

value_schema.description: An exclusion query on the input data of the security rules, which could be logs, Agent events, or other types of data based on the security rule. Events matching this query are ignored by any detection rules referenced in the suppression rule.

parameters.name: suppression_rule_description
parameters.description: A text description of the suppression rule, explaining its purpose and details.

value_schema.description: A description for the suppression rule.

parameters.name: suppression_rule_expiration_date
parameters.description: A Unix millisecond timestamp for when the suppression rule expires and stops suppressing signals.

value_schema.description: A Unix millisecond timestamp giving an expiration date for the suppression rule. After this date, it won't suppress signals anymore.

parameters.name: suppression_rule_start_date
parameters.description: Unix millisecond timestamp for the start date of the suppression rule, when it begins suppressing signals.

value_schema.description: A Unix millisecond timestamp giving the start date for the suppression rule. After this date, it starts suppressing signals.

parameters.name: suppression_query
parameters.description: The query for the suppression rule. Signals matching this query are suppressed, using Signals Explorer syntax.

value_schema.description: The suppression query of the suppression rule. If a signal matches this query, it is suppressed and is not triggered. It uses the same syntax as the queries to search signals in the Signals Explorer.
